tool_description: Checks the current status of certificates by verifying against CRL, OCSP responses, and certificate validity periods to determine if certificates are valid, revoked, or expired.

check_chain.description: Whether to validate the certificate chain

error_messages: Invalid certificate format: Certificate must be valid PEM or DER encoded X.509 certificate.
Certificate parsing failed: Unable to parse certificate data structure.
CRL unavailable: Cannot access Certificate Revocation List for status checking.
OCSP responder unavailable: OCSP service is not responding for revocation checking.
Chain validation failed: Certificate chain cannot be validated to trusted root.
usage: Provide certificate_data as Base64-encoded certificate. Optionally disable revocation or chain checking. Tool returns comprehensive status information about the certificate.

certificate_status.description: Overall certificate status: VALID, REVOKED, EXPIRED, or UNKNOWN

validity_status.description: Time validity status: VALID, EXPIRED, or NOT_YET_VALID

revocation_status.description: Revocation status: NOT_REVOKED, REVOKED, or UNKNOWN

days_until_expiry.description: Number of days until certificate expires
